intro: Zaehringia, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the Brassicaceae family. These plants are typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where they thrive in well-drained soils. Zaehringia species are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that often have four petals. They are generally perennial and can be found across various regions in the Northern Hemisphere. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
